post.summary: The RPC used to create a new scan of an ancestry.

get.summary: The RPC used to read the results of scanning for a particular ancestry.

parameters.name: with_vulnerabilities
parameters.description: Whether to include vulnerabilities or not in the response.

parameters.name: with_features
parameters.description: Whether to include features or not in the response.

get.summary: The RPC used to get a particularly Notification.

parameters.name: old_vulnerability_page
parameters.description:
The current page of previous vulnerabilities for the ancestry.
This will be empty when it is the first page.

parameters.name: new_vulnerability_page
parameters.description:
The current page of vulnerabilities for the ancestry.
This will be empty when it is the first page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The requested maximum number of results per page.

delete.summary: The RPC used to mark a Notification as read after it has been processed.

name.description: The name of the desired ancestry.

features.description:
The list of features present in the ancestry.
This will only be provided if requested.

layers.description: The layers present in the ancestry.

scanned_listers.description: The configured list of feature listers used to scan this ancestry.

scanned_detectors.description: The configured list of namespace detectors used to scan an ancestry.

name.description: The name of the requested notification.

created.description: The time at which the notification was created.

notified.description: The time at which the notification was last sent out.

deleted.description: The time at which a notification has been deleted.

old.description: The previous vulnerability and a paginated view of the ancestries it affects.

new.description: The newly updated vulnerability and a paginated view of the ancestries it affects.

index.description:
The index is an ever increasing number associated with the particular ancestry.
This is useful if you're processing notifications, and need to keep track of the progress of paginating the results.

path.description: The location of the layer (URL or filepath).

headers.description: Any HTTP Headers that need to be used if requesting a layer over HTTP(S).

listers.description: The configured list of feature listers used to scan an ancestry.

detectors.description: The configured list of namespace detectors used to scan an ancestry.

last_update_time.description: The time at which the updater last ran.

namespace_name.description: The name of the namespace in which the feature is detected.

version.description: The specific version of this feature.

version_format.description: The format used to parse version numbers for the feature.

vulnerabilities.description: The list of vulnerabilities that affect the feature.

status.description: The status of Clair at the time of the request.

hash.description: The sha256 tarsum for the layer.

current_page.description: The identifier for the current page.

next_page.description:
The token used to request the next page.
This will be empty when there are no more pages.

limit.description: The requested maximum number of results per page.

vulnerability.description: The vulnerability that affects a given set of ancestries.

ancestries.description: The ancestries affected by a vulnerability.

ancestry_name.description:
The name of the ancestry being scanned.
If scanning OCI images, this should be the hash of the manifest.

format.description: The format of the image being uploaded.

layers.description: The layers to be scanned for this particular ancestry.

status.description: The status of Clair at the time of the request.

namespace_name.description: The name of the namespace in which the vulnerability was detected.

description.description: A description of the vulnerability according to the source for the namespace.

link.description: A link to the vulnerability according to the source for the namespace.

metadata.description: Namespace agnostic metadata about the vulnerability.

fixed_by.description:
The feature that fixes this vulnerability.
This field only exists when a vulnerability is a part of a Feature.

affected_versions.description:
The Features that are affected by the vulnerability.
This field only exists when a vulnerability is a part of a Notification.

protobufEmpty.title:
A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
or the response type of an API method. For instance:
